result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brita Jane Britt

defendant.name: Britt, Brita Jane
defendant.address: 370 W Main St. Apt 2, Ellsworth, WI 54011

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned 1:43 pm.

1:32 AM Brita Jane Britt appears in Court, Atty Derek W Sanders, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin.. Officer Matthew Miller. S/T. Court questions Officer Miller. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Sanders. ADA Schieffer is asking the Court find probable cause and bind DE over, Atty Sanders gives argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
filed by ADA Joseph Schiefferi. eif

records.addlTxt:

Not to possess controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
11:45 AM Defendant Brita Jane Britt appeared by video.  Attorney Halle Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Derek Sanders appeared via phone. Defendant has copy of complaint. Defendant qualifies for the PD. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights.Defendant waives further reading.  DA Hatch requests $10,000 signature bond w/absolute sobriety, Not to possess controlled substances without a valid prescription. Sanders- no objection. Court orders bond as requested. The Court reviews the bond conditions and verifies the DOB, address and phone # with the defendant..
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
